image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old Canberra boy is behind bars after shocking allegations he developed detailed plans for public attacks and had equipment to create a bomb in his bedroom.

title.children: Canberra teen behind bars over 'wannabe terrorist' attack plans

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

title.children: Obeids and Macdonald take $30m coal corruption case to High Court

image.altText: David Pocock

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's 2023 promise to fix a "building with buckets to collect leaks" remains unfulfilled, according to the National Gallery of Australia's annual report.

title.children: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5b national collection

image.altText: Black-and-white picture of Ben Aulich.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has found a Canberra woman was unfairly stripped of the value of her shares in two companies founded by former lawyer Ben Aulich, awarding her $500,000 in compensation.

title.children: Judge rules Canberra woman entitled to $500k after share dispute

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a black blazer stands in a conference room looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's dire financial situation is "improving", and interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown says the university has now set a new target of delivering a surplus next year.

title.children: Rebekah Brown says ANU campus 'a lot calmer' since she came on board

image.altText: A boy does an activity at a table with his father.

props.synopsis: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

title.children: 'Terrible to watch': Why one family pulled their son from a Canberra public school

image.altText: A woman in a white blouse sits outdoors, painting at a table.

props.synopsis: A Victorian parliamentary probe into the impacts of cults and organised fringe groups hears lived experience testimony from two women who grew up in high-control religious groups.

title.children: Mirriam was born into the Church of Scientology. Now she's pushing for change

image.altText: Thunderclouds with a bolt of lightning, seen across paddocks.

props.synopsis: Severe weather has swept through large parts of the Great Southern and Wheatbelt, causing significant damage to crops during the critical harvest period.

title.children: Hail stones and heavy rain wreak havoc for WA farmers and businesses

image.altText: Tasmanian Treasurer Eric Abetz gestures with his hands.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Treasurer Eric Abetz has vowed to take "decisive action" to rein in the ballooning debt, but the "interim" state budget contains few major initiatives.

title.children: Abetz reveals lower Tasmanian debt, recommits to public service job cuts

image.altText: A girl looking at the camera with a beach behind.

props.synopsis: The findings of a coronial inquest into the death of German backpacker Simone Strobel in Lismore in 2005 have been delivered.

title.children: Boyfriend welcomes findings of inquest into backpacker's cold case murder

image.altText: A truck crashed into a bridge

props.synopsis: A cherry picker passenger has died after the vehicle crashed into a bridge in the NSW Central West, causing it to collapse.

title.children: Transport worker dead after bridge collapses in cherry picker crash

image.altText: A giant black smoke plume rising above a suburban skyline, trees and a cargo train

props.synopsis: Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg has confirmed the death toll has risen to at least 11 and could increase further to 12 or more, with several people still missing.

title.children: UPS plane  death toll rises, authorities say engine fell off before crash

image.altText: high speed rail exterior

props.synopsis: The business case for high-speed rail between Sydney and Newcastle identifies four initial station locations for a one-hour journey.

title.children: Key agency gives green light to Sydney-Newcastle high-speed rail by 2037

image.altText: Two people holding out their forearms and applying sunscreen on a sunny beach.

props.synopsis: A review by Australia's pharmaceutical regulator has raised concerns about "endocrine disruptors" in some sunscreens. Is there any reason to be worried?

title.children: Do sunscreen ingredients affect hormones? We asked the experts

image.altText: an old 2028 image of serial rapist Graham James Kay getting into a car after leaving court

props.synopsis: Convicted rapist Graham Kay will remain in custody after sexually touching a 16-year-old girl in the Sydney CBD while on a strict supervision order.

title.children: Serial rapist admits to sexually touching 16yo girl in Sydney pharmacy

image.altText: Claire Austin who was the victim of an alleged domestic violence attack holds a glass of wine while smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The 44-year-old is charged almost seven months after Claire Austin's death in Randwick.

title.children: Man charged with murder and coercive control after woman's death

image.altText: Three men dressed in black walk with a woman in a beige dress on green carpet.

props.synopsis: Prince William has joined Kylie Minogue and Shawn Mendes, along with a swag of world leaders and celebrities, for the annual Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro.

title.children: Prince William joins world leaders, celebs for green-carpeted Earthshot Prize awards

image.altText: A view of a National Australia Bank logo in Sydney

props.synopsis: NAB shares have dropped after reporting a dip in net profit, as the bank's boss flags housing as Australia's biggest challenge. But the big move of the day came from James Hardie, with its stock plunging 13%.

title.children: As it happened  -- NAB shares down on weaker profit and James Hardie shares plunge

image.altText: Albanese gestures while sitting next to a child.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says he is confident Australia's social media age limit will be a success when it begins next month.

title.children: 'The world is watching': PM says he's confident social media ban will work

image.altText: A man with glasses and dark hair standing in front of a wall with graffiti.

props.synopsis: Many young men are rejecting the "Herculean cookie-cutter mould" of masculinity, but a new report warns boys who hold rigid views are suffering.

title.children: 'Be whoever you want to be': Young men increasingly reject 'Man Box' rules

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president says a swathe of bad election results this week are a result of the weeks-long political stalemate that has seen many federal workers go unpaid and crucial government programs unfunded.

title.children: Trump blames record US government shutdown for election drubbings

image.altText: the us capitol dome lit by the sunset and reflected on a car window

props.synopsis: The ongoing federal government shutdown has surpassed the record for the longest in US history, leaving thousands of workers without pay. Here are some of the key numbers.

title.children: 36 days, $14b and 42 million hungry: Inside a record-breaking US shutdown

image.altText: A van sits outside a bowling club with the letters L R B C on the front while in the background the sun  goes down.

props.synopsis: A Walgett Shire councillor stands down while investigations continue into an alleged assault at a bowling club.

title.children: Councillor charged over alleged assault of female worker at bowling club

image.altText: CCTV image of a police car on a street.

props.synopsis: Two bystanders have helped detain a man who was allegedly seen wielding a knife and behaving erratically in Melbourne's CBD.

title.children: Charges laid after man stabbed during citizens' arrest in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: A shirtless man in gloves cleans up a house destroyed by a typhoon, with widespread destruction around.

props.synopsis: The death toll from Typhoon Kalmaegi in the Philippines has risen as the storm gathers strength and heads towards Vietnam.

title.children: Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves 114 dead and 127 missing in Philippines

image.altText: A close-up shows flashing lights at night time on top of a police car.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 21-year-old man with murder for allegedly killing another man by driving a car into him during a brawl in a remote Northern Territory town.

title.children: Man charged with murder for allegedly killing 27yo with his car during brawl

image.altText: The side profile of Greg Lynn leaving a court room wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The High Country killer's legal team says the 32-year prison sentence Lynn was handed for the murder of Carol Clay was "manifestly excessive".

title.children: 'Excessive' sentence could see Greg Lynn die in prison, lawyers argue

image.altText: Tatiana Dokhotaru looks at the camera, she was found dead inside her unit in 2023

props.synopsis: Danny Zayat has been found guilty of murdering his ex-partner Tatiana Dokhotaru after a heated argument inside her Liverpool apartment two years ago.

title.children: Man guilty of murdering woman after claiming she 'purposely killed herself’

image.altText: An animated illustration of a man with a computer for a hear with moving clouds behind him.

props.synopsis: We asked readers if they had thoughts or concerns about the rise of AI. This is what they told us.

title.children: 'Training myself out of a job': Lawyers, teachers and doctors speak out about AI

image.altText: Smiling man in hat stands among artworks

props.synopsis: Known for his generosity and a spectacular art gallery home filled with colourful works, Peter "Jungle" Phillips is remembered by those who loved him dearly.

title.children: Adelaide artist 'Jungle' Phillips dies aged 69 in his colourful home

image.altText: Jake Weatherald holds his helmet

props.synopsis: Jake Weatherald could become the latest player to represent Australia in the Ashes following a superb 18 months in the Sheffield Shield. But his path to the Test squad has not been conventional.

title.children: Jake Weatherald's route to the Test squad a path less trodden

image.altText: Australian men's Test cricket captain Pat Cummins looks at the camera as he wears his baggy green and holds a ball.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins says his return to bowling has gone better than expected, with Australia's captain still eyeing off a return for the second Ashes Test.

title.children: Pat Cummins feeling good for Gabba Test, but rest may be needed

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios hits a shot

props.synopsis: A revitalised Nick Kyrgios has revealed his shock plans to make a summer comeback and hopefully play the Australian Open in January.

title.children: Kyrgios targets Australian Open after 'miracle' knee recovery

image.altText: Two F1 drivers in the pits, the CEO shaking hands with one of them

props.synopsis: McLaren's boss says he would rather Red Bull's Max Verstappen win the Formula 1 drivers' championship than prefer one of his racers over the other.

title.children: McLaren doubles down on not prioritising Piastri or Norris for F1 title

image.altText: a woman in scrubs sitting at a desk in a medical practice

props.synopsis: Julia Creek welcomes a rural Australian GP after running a viral job campaign and receiving 95 applications from across the globe.

title.children: Outback doctor heard about $600k job over a beer, not viral campaign
